Overview¶

(Something about what can be accomplished with buddy.)

Connecting to Buddy¶

Buddy can be accessed in a couple of ways.

Through a Browser¶

Go to buddy.uco.edu Enter your username and password

Through SSH¶

(instructions for connecting through ssh)

Linux on Buddy¶

Buddy uses linux as its operating system. Many of the day to day operations are similar to other operating systems like Window and MacOS. For more information see: Creating and Editing Files and Using the Terminal.

What is a Slurm Job?¶

A job is a convenient way to execute code on Buddy. A job script is created which sets up the environment, loads relevant modules, and executes one or several commands. When the job is run with slurm it is placed in a queue until the requested resources are available and then it is executed. For more information about SLURM jobs see: Creating a Basic Job, Slurm, and Modules.
